title: Modifying plots
code: p +   labs(title = 'My comments on the results',        subtitle = NULL,        caption = 'December 2021',        x = 'Mean diff b/t treatment and control')

title: Modifying plots
code: p +    theme_classic() # set the theme for all plots within this R session theme_set(theme_bw())

what: Extract data to reconstruct the plot:
title: Modifying plots
code: p$data #> # A tibble: 6 × 2 #>   name       diff #>   <chr>     <dbl> #> 1 age      0.107  #> 2 black    0.0438 #> 3 educ     0.144  #> 4 hisp    -0.170  #> 5 married  0.0943 #> 6 nodegr  -0.306

title: Modifying plots
text: ggplot2 cheatsheet Labels Complete themes Modify theme

title: Authors and Citation
text: Joseph Marlo. Author, maintainer. George Perrett. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Marlo J, Perrett G (2022). plotBart: Diagnostic Plotting Functions Supplement bartCause. https://joemarlo.github.io/plotBart, https://github.com/joemarlo/plotBart.
code: @Manual{,   title = {plotBart: Diagnostic and Plotting Functions to Supplement bartCause},   author = {Joseph Marlo and George Perrett},   year = {2022},   note = {https://joemarlo.github.io/plotBart, https://github.com/joemarlo/plotBart}, }

what: Diagnostic and Plotting Functions to Supplement bartCause
title: Diagnostic and Plotting Functions to Supplement bartCause
text: plotBart diagnostic plotting package bartCause thinkCausal.
code: library(plotBart) data(lalonde) confounders <- c('age', 'educ', 'black', 'hisp', 'married', 'nodegr')  # fit BART model model_results <- bartCause::bartc(   response = lalonde[['re78']],   treatment = lalonde[['treat']],   confounders = as.matrix(lalonde[, confounders]),   estimand = 'ate',   commonSup.rule = 'none',   verbose = FALSE,   keepTrees = TRUE )  # plot common support plot_common_support(.model = model_results) # plot CATE and manipulate ggplot object plot_CATE(   .model = model_results,    type = 'density',    ci_80 = TRUE,    ci_95 = TRUE,   .mean = TRUE ) +    labs(subtitle = 'My comments on the results') +   theme_classic()

title: Diagnostic and Plotting Functions to Supplement bartCause
text: plotBart currently development available test installing via:
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("joemarlo/plotBart")

what: Plot histogram or density of individual treatment effects — plot_CATE
title: Plot histogram or density of individual treatment effects — plot_CATE
Plot histogram or density of individual treatment effects — plot_CATE
code: plot_CATE(   .model,   type = c("histogram", "density"),   ci_80 = FALSE,   ci_95 = FALSE,   reference = NULL,   .mean = FALSE,   .median = FALSE )

title: Plot histogram or density of individual treatment effects — plot_CATE
text: .model model produced bartCause::bartc() type histogram density ci_80 TRUE/FALSE. Show 80% credible interval? ci_95 TRUE/FALSE. Show 95% credible interval? reference numeric. Show vertical reference line x-axis value .mean TRUE/FALSE. Show mean reference line .median TRUE/FALSE. Show median reference line

title: Plot histogram or density of individual treatment effects — plot_CATE
Plot histogram or density of individual treatment effects — plot_CATE
Plot histogram or density of individual treatment effects — plot_CATE
code: # \dontrun{ data(lalonde) confounders <- c('age', 'educ', 'black', 'hisp', 'married', 'nodegr') model_results <- bartCause::bartc(  response = lalonde[['re78']],  treatment = lalonde[['treat']],  confounders = as.matrix(lalonde[, confounders]),  estimand = 'ate',  commonSup.rule = 'none' ) #> fitting treatment model via method 'bart' #> fitting response model via method 'bart' plot_CATE(model_results) #> `stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.  # }

title: Plot icates — plot_ICATE
Plot icates — plot_ICATE
code: plot_ICATE(.model, .group_by = NULL, n_bins = 30, .alpha = 0.7)

title: Plot icates — plot_ICATE
text: .model model produced bartCause::bartc() .group_by grouping variable vector n_bins number bins. Defaults 30 .alpha transparency histograms

title: Plot icates — plot_ICATE
Plot icates — plot_ICATE
Plot icates — plot_ICATE
code: # \dontrun{ data(lalonde) confounders <- c('age', 'educ', 'black', 'hisp', 'married', 'nodegr') model_results <- bartCause::bartc(  response = lalonde[['re78']],  treatment = lalonde[['treat']],  confounders = as.matrix(lalonde[, confounders]),  estimand = 'ate',  commonSup.rule = 'none' ) #> fitting treatment model via method 'bart' #> fitting response model via method 'bart' plot_ICATE(model_results, lalonde$married)  # }

text: .data dataframe treatment character. Name treatment column within .data response character. plotBart 0.1.4
text: propensity_scores() longer exported Removed legend argument plot_moderator_c_pd(). Legend can modified using p + theme(legend.position = "<position>")

title: plotBart 0.1.3
text: Homogenized function argument names across functions. code breaking previous argument names supported. plot_moderator_search() now returns ggplot object instead rpart.plot object

title: plotBart 0.1.2
plotBart 0.1.0
